Articles.Content:
So, I was playing in a career mode save(WITH FAR), and I was testing my new Kerbal space shuttle, Babylon, the first successful one I ever built from scratch(Yay me!  ), and I was preparing for reentry and landing.  Earlier in the flight, I noticed when I toggled map mode, the craft didn't show up, but planets and trajectories did.  So, there I am, reentering the atmosphere at 2 km/s, preparing for deceleration, and instead, the craft just kept on accelerating.  I have no idea why.  Jeb and Val kept on smiling until they hit the ground, those poor Kerbals.

Picture of the craft:

Mods used:

Mechjeb

PlanetShine

BetterTimeWarp

Contract Configurator with Anomaly Surveyor

Ferram Aerospace Research

Texture Replacer

Kerbal Joint Reinforcement

SCANsat

Tarsier Space Tech

Waypoint Manager

6 minutes ago, Snowstorm said:

Earlier in the flight, I noticed when I toggled map mode, the craft didn't show up, but planets and trajectories did.  So, there I am, reentering the atmosphere at 2 km/s, preparing for deceleration, and instead, the craft just kept on accelerating.  I have no idea why.

You probably turned off your category of icon in map view.

It's accelerating because it's descending and gravity is providing the kinetic energy. Your spaceplane/shuttle looks pretty aerodynamic and will not drag too much if you don't enter with a decent AoA. Entering atmosphere does not mean an automatic deceleration.

Just now, FancyMouse said:

You probably turned off your category of icon in map view.

It's accelerating because it's descending and gravity is providing the kinetic energy. Your spaceplane/shuttle looks pretty aerodynamic and will not drag too much if you don't enter with a decent AoA. Entering atmosphere does not mean an automatic deceleration.

I was pointing radial the whole time.  It just kept on accelerating.  As for the map view, I think you're right.
In mechjeb, go to utilities and make sure none of the defaults are insane...
